intro: Eriogonum gracile var. acetoselloides, commonly known as the smallleaf buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its small, gray-green leaves and showy, clustered white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats such as slopes and gravelly soils. It produces small, three-lobed fruits that contain minute seeds, which are dispersed by wind. This species is adapted to arid environments and is often found in disturbed or open areas.
